Member States shall ensure, where appropriate, consultation and cooperation between those authorities, and between those authorities and national authorities entrusted with the implementation of competition law and national authorities entrusted with the implementation of consumer law , on matters of common interest. Where more than one authority has competence to address such matters, Member States shall ensure that the respective tasks of each authority are published in an easily accessible form.
annotations.translation: 机构。成员国应酌情确保这些主管机构之间，以及负责执行竞争法的主管机构与负责执行消费者法的国家主管机构之间就共同关心的事项进行磋商与合作。如果不止一个主管机构有权处理此类事项，成员国应确保以易于查阅的形式公布每个主管机构各自的任务。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 5. National regulatory authorities and national competition authorities shall provide each other with the information necessary for the application of the provisions of this Directive and the Specific Directives . In respect of the information exchanged, the receiving authority shall ensure the same level of confidentiality as the originating authority.
annotations.translation: 5. 国家监管机构和国家竞争主管机构应相互提供适用本指令和具体指令的规定所需的信息。对于交换的信息，接收机构应确保其保密程度与始发机构相同。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 6. Member States shall notify to the Commission all national regulatory authorities assigned tasks under this Directive and the Specific Directives, and their respective responsibilities.
annotations.translation: 6. 成员国应向委员会通报根据本指令和具体指令分配任务的所有国家监管机构及其各自的职责。

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: Article 4
annotations.translation: 第 4 条

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: Right of appeal
annotations.translation: 上诉权

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 1. Member States shall ensure that effective mechanisms exist at national level under which any user or undertaking providing electronic communications networks and/or services who is affected by a decision of a national regulatory authority has the right of appeal against the decision to an appeal body that is independent of the parties involved. This body, which may be a court, shall have the appropriate expertise available to it to enable it to carry out its functions. Member States shall ensure that the merits of the case are duly taken into account and that there is an effective appeal mechanism. Pending the outcome of any such appeal, the decision of the national regulatory authority shall stand, unless the appeal body decides otherwise.
annotations.translation: 1. 成员国应确保在国家层面建立有效的机制，根据这些机制，提供电子通信网络和/或服务的任何用户或企业在受到国家监管机构的决定影响时，有权就该决定向独立于有关各方的上诉机构提出上诉。该机构，可以是法院，应拥有适当的专业知识，使其能够履行其职能。成员国应确保案件的是非曲直得到适当考虑，并确保具备有效的上诉机制。在任何此类上诉结果出来之前，除非上诉机构另有决定，否则国家监管机构的决定仍然有效。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 2. Where the appeal body referred to in paragraph 1 is not judicial in character, written reasons for its decision shall always be given. Furthermore, in such a case, its decision shall be subject to review by a court or tribunal within the meaning of Article 234 of the Treaty.
annotations.translation: 2. 如果第 1 段所述上诉机构不具有司法性质，则应始终以书面形式说明其决定的理由。 此外，在这种情况下，其决定应接受《条约》第 234 条所指的法院或法庭的审查。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: timescales and level of detail required by the national regulatory authority. The information requested by the national regulatory authority shall be proportionate to the performance of that task. The national regulatory authority shall give the reasons justifying its request for information.
annotations.translation: 国家监管机构要求的时限和详细程度。国家监管机构要求提供的信息应与履行该任务相称。 国家监管机构应说明其要求提供信息的理由。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 2. Member States shall ensure that national regulatory authorities provide the Commission, after a reasoned request, with the information necessary for it to carry out its tasks under the Treaty. The information requested by the Commission shall be proportionate to the performance of those tasks. Where the information provided refers to information previously provided by undertakings at the request of the national regulatory authority, such undertakings shall be informed thereof. To the extent necessary, and unless the authority that provides the information has made an explicit and reasoned request to the contrary, the Commission shall make the information provided available to another such authority in another Member State.
annotations.translation: 2. 成员国应确保国家监管当局在委员会提出合理要求后，向其提供必要的信息，以便委员会履行本条约规定的任务。 委员会要求提供的信息应与履行这些任务相称。 如果所提供的信息涉及企业先前应国家监管当局的要求提供的信息，则应告知这些企业。 在必要的情况下，除非提供信息的机构提出明确和合理的相反要求，否则委员会应将所提供的信息提供给另一成员国的另一个此类机构。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Subject to the requirements of paragraph 3, Member States shall ensure that the information submitted to one national regulatory authority can be made available to another such authority in the same or different Member State, after a substantiated request, where necessary to allow either authority to fulfil its responsibilities under Community law.
annotations.translation: 在不违反第 3 段要求的前提下，成员国应确保提交给一个国家监管机构的信息，在提出经证实的请求后，在必要时可以提供给同一或不同成员国的另一个此类监管机构，以便任一监管机构履行其在共同体法律下的职责。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 3. Where information is considered confidential by a national regulatory authority in accordance with Community and national rules on business confidentiality, the Commission and the national regulatory authorities concerned shall ensure such confidentiality.
annotations.translation: 3. 如果国家监管机构根据共同体和国家有关商业机密的规则将信息视为机密，则委员会和有关国家监管机构应确保此类机密性。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 4 . Member States shall ensure that, acting in accordance with national rules on public access to information and subject to Community and national rules on business confidentiality, national regulatory authorities publish such information as would contribute to an open and competitive market.
annotations.translation: 4. 成员国应确保国家监管机构根据本国关于公众获取信息的规则行事，并在遵守共同体和本国关于商业机密的规则的前提下，公布有助于开放和竞争市场的信息。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 5. National regulatory authorities shall publish the terms of public access to information as referred to in paragraph 4, including procedures for obtaining such access.
annotations.translation: 5. 国家监管机构应公布第 4 段所述的公众获取信息的条款，包括获取此类信息的程序。
